functions.name: Govern
functions.description: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored.

categories.name: Organizational Context
categories.description: The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood.

subcategories.name: Mission Understanding
subcategories.description: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management.

maturity_criteria.0: No documented mission or cybersecurity alignment
maturity_criteria.1: Mission exists but not linked to cybersecurity

subcategories.name: Stakeholder Expectations
subcategories.description: Internal and external stakeholders are understood, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood and considered.

subcategories.name: Legal and Regulatory Requirements
subcategories.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed.

subcategories.name: Critical Objectives
subcategories.description: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated.

subcategories.name: Outcomes and Dependencies
subcategories.description: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and communicated.

categories.name: Risk Management Strategy
categories.description: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions.

subcategories.name: Risk Management Objectives
subcategories.description: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

subcategories.name: Risk Appetite and Tolerance
subcategories.description: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained.

maturity_criteria.3: Risk appetite actively used in decisions
maturity_criteria.4: Dynamic risk appetite based on conditions

subcategories.name: Risk Management Activities
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes.

subcategories.name: Strategic Direction
subcategories.description: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated.

subcategories.name: Communication Lines
subcategories.description: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties.

subcategories.name: Standardized Method
subcategories.description: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated.

subcategories.name: Strategic Opportunities
subcategories.description: Strategic opportunities (i.e., positive risks) are characterized and are included in organizational cybersecurity risk discussions.

categories.name: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities
categories.description: Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated.

subcategories.name: Leadership Accountability
subcategories.description: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving.

subcategories.name: Roles Established
subcategories.description: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced.

subcategories.name: Adequate Resources
subcategories.description: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies.

subcategories.name: Performance Evaluation
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices.

maturity_criteria.4: Security culture in all HR practices

categories.name: Policy
categories.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced.

subcategories.name: Policy Established
subcategories.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced.

subcategories.name: Policy Review
subcategories.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission.

categories.name: Oversight
categories.description: Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy.

subcategories.name: Risk Management Review
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction.

subcategories.name: Strategy Adjustment
subcategories.description: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks.

subcategories.name: Performance Evaluation
subcategories.description: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is evaluated and reviewed for adjustments needed.

categories.name: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management
categories.description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders.

subcategories.name: Supply Chain Program
subcategories.description: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

subcategories.name: Supplier Roles
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally.

subcategories.name: Supply Chain Integration
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes.

subcategories.name: Supplier Assessment
subcategories.description: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality.

subcategories.name: Supplier Requirements
subcategories.description: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties.

subcategories.name: Due Diligence
subcategories.description: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships.

subcategories.name: Supplier Risk Understanding
subcategories.description: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are understood, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship.

subcategories.name: Supplier Inclusion
subcategories.description: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities.

subcategories.name: Supply Chain Security
subcategories.description: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle.

subcategories.name: Supply Chain Plan
subcategories.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement.

functions.name: Identify
functions.description: The organization's current cybersecurity risks are understood.

categories.name: Asset Management
categories.description: Assets (e.g., data, hardware, software, systems, facilities, services, people) that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy.

subcategories.name: Hardware Inventory
subcategories.description: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained.

subcategories.name: Software Inventory
subcategories.description: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained.

subcategories.name: Data Flow Mapping
subcategories.description: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained.

subcategories.name: External Service Inventory
subcategories.description: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained.

subcategories.name: Asset Prioritization
subcategories.description: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact to the mission.

subcategories.name: Data Inventory
subcategories.description: Inventories of data and corresponding metadata for designated data types are maintained.

subcategories.name: System Use Management
subcategories.description: Systems, hardware, software, services, and data are managed throughout their life cycles.

categories.name: Risk Assessment
categories.description: The cybersecurity risk to the organization, assets, and individuals is understood.

subcategories.name: Vulnerability Identification
subcategories.description: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded.

subcategories.name: Threat Intelligence
subcategories.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

subcategories.name: Threat Identification
subcategories.description: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded.

subcategories.name: Impact Analysis
subcategories.description: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded.

subcategories.name: Risk Determination
subcategories.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization.

subcategories.name: Risk Response
subcategories.description: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated.

subcategories.name: Risk Management Changes
subcategories.description: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked.

subcategories.name: Risk Prioritization
subcategories.description: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established.

subcategories.name: Asset Authenticity
subcategories.description: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use.

subcategories.name: Critical Supplier Assessment
subcategories.description: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition.

categories.name: Improvement
categories.description: Improvements to organizational cybersecurity risk management processes, procedures, and activities are identified across all CSF Functions.

subcategories.name: Improvement Identification
subcategories.description: Improvements are identified from evaluations.

subcategories.name: Improvement Implementation
subcategories.description: Improvements are prioritized and implemented.

subcategories.name: Evaluation Sharing
subcategories.description: Improvements are evaluated through exercises and real-world execution.

subcategories.name: Process Effectiveness
subcategories.description: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved.

functions.name: Protect
functions.description: Safeguards to manage the organization's cybersecurity risks are used.

categories.name: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control
categories.description: Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware and managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.

subcategories.name: Identity Management
subcategories.description: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization.

subcategories.name: Identity Proofing
subcategories.description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions.

subcategories.name: Authentication
subcategories.description: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated.

subcategories.name: Identity Assertions
subcategories.description: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified.

subcategories.name: Access Permissions
subcategories.description: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

subcategories.name: Physical Access
subcategories.description: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk.

categories.name: Awareness and Training
categories.description: The organization's personnel are provided with cybersecurity awareness and training so that they can perform their cybersecurity-related tasks.

subcategories.name: Security Awareness
subcategories.description: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

subcategories.name: Specialized Training
subcategories.description: Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

categories.name: Data Security
categories.description: Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

subcategories.name: Data-at-Rest Protection
subcategories.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected.

subcategories.name: Data-in-Transit Protection
subcategories.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected.

subcategories.name: Data-in-Use Protection
subcategories.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected.

subcategories.name: Data Backup
subcategories.description: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested.

categories.name: Platform Security
categories.description: The hardware, software (e.g., firmware, operating systems, applications), and services of physical and virtual platforms are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect their confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

subcategories.name: Configuration Management
subcategories.description: Configuration management practices are established and applied.

subcategories.name: Software Maintenance
subcategories.description: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

subcategories.name: Hardware Maintenance
subcategories.description: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

subcategories.name: Log Records
subcategories.description: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring.

subcategories.name: Software Installation
subcategories.description: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented.

subcategories.name: Secure Development
subcategories.description: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle.

categories.name: Technology Infrastructure Resilience
categories.description: Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience.

subcategories.name: Network Protection
subcategories.description: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage.

subcategories.name: Security Architecture
subcategories.description: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats.

subcategories.name: Resilience Mechanisms
subcategories.description: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

subcategories.name: Capacity Resources
subcategories.description: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained.

functions.name: Detect
functions.description: Possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises are found and analyzed.

categories.name: Continuous Monitoring
categories.description: Assets are monitored to find anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events.

subcategories.name: Network Monitoring
subcategories.description: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

subcategories.name: Physical Environment Monitoring
subcategories.description: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events.

subcategories.name: Personnel Activity Monitoring
subcategories.description: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

subcategories.name: External Service Monitoring
subcategories.description: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

subcategories.name: Computing Hardware Monitoring
subcategories.description: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

categories.name: Adverse Event Analysis
categories.description: Anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events are analyzed to characterize the events and detect cybersecurity incidents.

subcategories.name: Event Analysis
subcategories.description: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities.

subcategories.name: Event Correlation
subcategories.description: Information is correlated from multiple sources.

subcategories.name: Impact Estimation
subcategories.description: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood.

subcategories.name: Incident Declaration
subcategories.description: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools.

subcategories.name: Threat Intelligence Integration
subcategories.description: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis.

subcategories.name: Incident Determination
subcategories.description: Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria.

functions.name: Respond
functions.description: Actions regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are taken.

categories.name: Incident Management
categories.description: Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed.

subcategories.name: Incident Response Plan
subcategories.description: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared.

subcategories.name: Incident Reporting
subcategories.description: Incident reports are triaged and validated.

subcategories.name: Incident Categorization
subcategories.description: Incidents are categorized and prioritized.

subcategories.name: Incident Escalation
subcategories.description: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed.

subcategories.name: Incident Forensics
subcategories.description: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied.

categories.name: Incident Analysis
categories.description: Investigations are conducted to ensure effective response and support forensics and recovery activities.

subcategories.name: Root Cause Analysis
subcategories.description: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident.

subcategories.name: Investigation Actions
subcategories.description: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the records' integrity and provenance are preserved.

subcategories.name: Incident Data Collection
subcategories.description: Incident data and metadata are collected, and their integrity and provenance are preserved.

subcategories.name: Incident Impact
subcategories.description: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated.

categories.name: Incident Response Reporting and Communication
categories.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders as required by laws, regulations, or policies.

subcategories.name: Internal Reporting
subcategories.description: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents.

subcategories.name: Information Sharing
subcategories.description: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders.

categories.name: Incident Mitigation
categories.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and to mitigate its effects.

subcategories.name: Containment
subcategories.description: Incidents are contained.

subcategories.name: Eradication
subcategories.description: Incidents are eradicated.

functions.name: Recover
functions.description: Assets and operations affected by a cybersecurity incident are restored.

categories.name: Incident Recovery Plan Execution
categories.description: Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents.

subcategories.name: Recovery Plan Execution
subcategories.description: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process.

subcategories.name: Recovery Selection
subcategories.description: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed.

subcategories.name: Backup Integrity
subcategories.description: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration.

subcategories.name: Critical Function Consideration
subcategories.description: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms.

subcategories.name: Restoration Verification
subcategories.description: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed.

subcategories.name: Recovery End Declaration
subcategories.description: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed.

categories.name: Incident Recovery Communication
categories.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties.

subcategories.name: Recovery Communication
subcategories.description: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders.

subcategories.name: Public Communication
subcategories.description: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging.
